original_solution_mapping.L1: Vanessa needs $80 - $20 = $<<80-20=60>>60 to buy the dress.
original_solution_mapping.L2: She manages to gather $30 - $10 = $<<30-10=20>>20 each week
original_solution_mapping.L3: The number of weeks she has to wait is 60 / 20 = <<60/20=3>>3 weeks.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5739.
    Returns: the number of weeks Vanessa has to wait to buy the dress.
    """
    # L1
    dress_cost = 80 # costs $80
    initial_savings = 20 # already has $20 in savings
    money_needed = dress_cost - initial_savings

    # L2
    weekly_allowance = 30 # parents give her $30 every week
    weekly_spending = 10 # spends $10 each weekend
    net_weekly_gain = weekly_allowance - weekly_spending

    # L3
    weeks_to_wait = money_needed / net_weekly_gain

    # FA
    answer = weeks_to_wait
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Vanessa needs ${dress_cost} - ${initial_savings} = $<<{dress_cost}-{initial_savings}={money_needed}>>{money_needed} to buy the dress.
She manages to gather ${weekly_allowance} - ${weekly_spending} = $<<{weekly_allowance}-{weekly_spending}={net_weekly_gain}>>{net_weekly_gain} each week
The number of weeks she has to wait is {money_needed} / {net_weekly_gain} = <<{money_needed}/{net_weekly_gain}={weeks_to_wait}>>{weeks_to_wait} weeks.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Vanessa needs $80 - $20 = $<<80-20=60>>60 to buy the dress.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She manages to gather $30 - $10 = $<<30-10=20>>20 each week
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The number of weeks she has to wait is 60 / 30 = <<60/30=2>>2 weeks.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'weekly_allowance' (value: 30) was used instead of 'net_weekly_gain' (value: 20).
